discourse_list.title: How to attract 1 million users with Oasis.app - Drinks with MakerDAO Delegates

content.content: Hello everyone - hope everyone made it home safely from Bogota (best wishes to @sorenpeter), has recovered from the con or from the FOMO by not being there. This weeks episode is another one with a guest - this time it was @ChrisB from Oasis.app giving some insights from one of the userfacing frontends with our protocol.  00:00 impression from Devcon Bogota 03:00 the usual drink tasting with references to the launch of MCD in 2019 and The Endgame   @rspa having a Simco 3 from Augsburg, Bavaria - good as a started or for asian food (?), a transpacific beer!  5 starts!    @ultraschuppi having a Fritz Orangeade (that’s not a beer!) - sweet, fruity, solid 4.8    @ChrisB having a Devon Cove Pale Ale - pretty hoppy, good afternoon beer - 3.5 to 4 stars    @flipflopflapdelegate  - Amor Perfecto Coffee (as he was still in Bogota) but did not say if it is good…   11:00 how @ChrisB got into Maker 17:00 what is Oasis.app 20:00 stoploss or why “nobody should be liquidated ever again” and its adoption 24:00 new feature: “take profit” 25:00 how Oasis.app gets userfeedback and observes userbehaviour 29:00 @ChrisB advocating for the Earn-product and why we destroyed it by raising SFs on GUNI-vaults   31:00 Free floating DAI and the long term plan for Oasis.app and “Maker taking risks” 35:30 ideas around new vault types with a lower oracle-delay 39:00 …and finally we move over into metaDaos, D3Ms and dust levels    47:00 rate sensitivity and why people are using the protocol 48:00 GUNI fees again 51:00 LINK is popular?? 57:00 what can we do to get some more traction 62:00 @flipflopflapdelegate asking awkward questions about the MOMC 66:00 going into L2s and outlook  enjoy!
content.GPT-summary: The post is a podcast episode featuring a guest from Oasis.app discussing their protocol and various topics related to it. The guest talks about their experience with Maker, what Oasis.app is, new features, user feedback, and future plans. The post also includes discussions on metaDaos, D3Ms, and LINK. The post is not advertising the proposal, but rather discussing it in-depth.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: Such an important conversation. I learned a lot in that hour.
Thanks so much for having me on - had a great time!
Am new in this community and this have really enlightening me more . Thanks
